intro: Epilobium angustissimum, commonly known as narrowleaf willowherb, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in moist environments such as wet meadows, riverbanks, and marshy areas. Epilobium angustissimum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a range of soil types.
